The development of AXIGEN Mail Server started in 2003. It was launched in September 2005; according to data released by Gecad, it is now used by over 400,000 mailboxes worldwide. [http://www.axigen.com/mail-server/news-AXIGEN_launches_v_2_0_commercial_-_a_new_feature-rich_version-press_release-32.php]
The development of AXIGEN Mail Server started in 2003. It was launched in September 2005; according to data released by Gecad, it is now used by over 400,000 mailboxes worldwide. [http://www.axigen.com/mail-server/news-AXIGEN_launches_v_2_0_commercial_-_a_new_feature-rich_version-press_release-32.php]
â
AXIGEN is available for many [[Linux distribution]]s (RPM-based w/o gcc4, [[Slackware]], [[Debian]], [[Gentoo Linux|Gentoo]], [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]]), [[BSD]] platforms and for Solaris. <ref>[http://www.axigen.com/mail-server/downloads.php AXIGEN download page]</ref>. The development plan includes [[Mac OS X]] and [[Microsoft Windows]] versions.
+
AXIGEN is available for many [[Linux distribution]]s (RPM-based w/o gcc4, [[Slackware]], [[Debian]], [[Gentoo Linux|Gentoo]], [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]]), [[BSD]] platforms and for Solaris. <ref>[http://www.axigen.com/mail-server/downloads.php AXIGEN download page]</ref>. The development plan includes [[Mac OS X]] and [[Microsoft Windows]] versions.
